name: NPR
text:
Tuesday's surge of Black progressives could prove notable for the presidential race. 

If Democrats have two key pillars of their base fired up â€” women and Black voters â€” that could be a game-changer, as President Trumpâ€™s approval continues to suffer.

name: NPR
text:
Opinion: @nprscottsimon remembers Michael Hawley, a remarkable polymath and exceptional friend, who died this past week at 58.

name: NPR
text:
South Korea conscripted over 30,000 soldiers between the ages of 14 to 17 for the Korean War. An estimated 3,000 died.

Some believe these child soldiers saved the nation from defeat. 

The survivors are nearing 90. And they still want proper recognition. https://t.co/ZprJyr6wd0

name: NPR
text: Unrest over racial injustice spotlights the acute need for â€” and the high historical barriers to â€” mental health treatment for Black people. https://t.co/b2tauuJR0q

name: NPR
text:
D.C.'s lack of congressional representation has prompted some residents â€” even those who've called the district home for years â€” to maintain their voting registrations elsewhere. 

Here's what an elections researcher says about the legality of that. ðŸ‘‡

name: NPR
text:
About 1 in 5 people in North Charleston â€” which is predominately Black and the third-largest city in South Carolina â€” live in poverty.

 Itâ€™s also a place known for having an eviction crisis. @hereandnow

name: NPR
NPR
text:
Many Black bookstore owners are busier than ever. Some tell NPR that they're grateful for the business, but heartbroken by the circumstances â€” and can't help but wonder how long the surge in interest will last.
https://t.co/QIQvOvPf6g

name: NPR
text: For the sixth and final entry in @nprmusic's week-long series of letters by music writers in the LGBTQ+ community, Deborah Sprague writes about songs that reflect her experience as a trans woman. https://t.co/Q1KY0m4id1

name: NPR
text:
Madame Gandhi uses music to help elevate and celebrate female voices, from working with primarily queer women BIPOC on tour and video sets to writing lyrics that challenge the white male-dominated music industry.

Watch her Tiny Desk (home) concert here ðŸ‘‡
https://t.co/i1e390rdJ2

name: NPR
text: Under the governor's plan, nursing homes can only reopen if they have had no cases of the coronavirus for 14 consecutive days. Individual facilities have broad leeway to set their own restrictions. https://t.co/rCHCAqyslJ

name: NPR
text: One person was killed and another injured after shots were fired in a Louisville, Ky., park where demonstrators gathered to protest the police killing of Breonna Taylor. https://t.co/iS0Z78UrtX

name: NPR
text:
President Trump retweeted a video of a white man â€” driving a golf cart with "Trump 2020" and "America First" signs â€” yelling "white power" in response to protesters.

Sharing the video, Trump wrote, "Thank you to the great people of The Villages."
https://t.co/PWM9MSkEPi

name: NPR
text: Princeton University will remove Woodrow Wilson's name from its public policy school over "racist thinking and policies" the former U.S. president had championed, the university says. https://t.co/NWkF9OQI8w

name: NPR
text:
Update: President Trump has deleted the tweet.

The White House did not apologize for the tweet, saying instead: "President Trump is a big fan of The Villages. He did not hear the one statement made on the video." https://t.co/gg5g3TUAGI

name: NPR
text:
Think of a five-letter animal. Remove the middle letter, and two opposites remain. What animal is it?

If you know the answer, submit your answer by following this link ðŸ‘‡

name: NPR
text: While former Colorado Gov. John Hickenlooper is still seen as having an edge in his state's Senate primary, recent and past comments about race have dampened enthusiasm for him among some voters. https://t.co/QO3GPorBs1

name: NPR
text:
President Trump is denying a New York Times report that he was briefed on an alleged Russian effort to pay bounties to Taliban-linked militants to kill Western forces â€” including U.S. forces â€” in Afghanistan.

"Nobody briefed or told me," he tweeted.
 https://t.co/A8pg0N1Jrt

name: NPR
text: Concerned about animals that could spread the coronavirus, China has announced a ban on wild animal breeding â€“ with some notable loopholes. https://t.co/fXf5jGzSZf

name: NPR
text: The first of three newly designated tax-free shopping days in Colombia came just as it eported its highest daily rate of new COVID-19 cases and deaths, prompting one mayor to call it "COVID Friday."  https://t.co/kOsQkCTsrd

text: The first of three newly designated tax-free shopping days in Colombia came just as it reported its highest daily rate of new COVID-19 cases and deaths, prompting one mayor to call it "COVID Friday." https://t.co/j0dpjyz2Ny

text:

Health officials estimate the actual case count could be much higher.

name: NPR
text:
"The talk" is what Black parents give their children, particularly their sons, about how they should deal with the police if they encounter them. 

It is a hard talk, a sad talk. 

And the stakes are really high. https://t.co/PAGWFfhKcA https://t.co/y9Pf4HTS0Y

name: NPR
text:
The Justice Department is charging four men with destruction of federal property over an attempt to topple a statue of Andrew Jackson in D.C. 
https://t.co/iujZd54GIq

name: NPR
text: @NPR The charges were filed the same day that President Trump signed an executive order promising a crackdown on the destruction of federal monuments and threatening prosecution to the fullest extent of the law. https://t.co/9D8cP081NW

name: NPR
text: Trump followed up his executive action by tweeting out wanted posters of people that U.S. Park Police say are responsible for damage to the park near the White House. https://t.co/ckdPBXzKQV

name: NPR
text: Lin-Manuel Miranda: "The language of revolution present in [Hamilton] from 244 years ago is being felt again ... by the Black and brown future of this country reckoning with what we want the future of this country to be going forward." https://t.co/QUlvIfKhnH

name: NPR
text: Sunday marked a grim milestone as global deaths from coronavirus totaled more than 500,000. A quarter of those are in the U.S. https://t.co/e2b3wYAFMn

name: NPR
text: A day after defending his right to hold campaign events amid spikes in coronavirus cases, Vice President Pence and the Trump campaign postponed two events he was to headline next week in Florida and Arizona. https://t.co/VfuoghIbe4

name: NPR
text:
There is a legal basis for mandatory masks, according to Lindsay Wiley, the director of American University's Health Law and Policy Program.

Wiley spoke to NPR about that legal basis. ðŸ‘‡
